questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Fourier Transform?

answers.a: To convert a time-domain signal into a frequency-domain representation
answers.c: To remove noise from a signal
answers.d: To convert analog signals into digital signals

explanations.a: The Fourier Transform decomposes a time-domain signal into sinusoidal frequency components.
explanations.b: Compression is not the main function of a Fourier Transform.
explanations.c: Noise reduction is an indirect benefit, not the core function.
explanations.d: This process is performed by ADCs, not Fourier Transforms.

questions.question: What does the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) operate on?

explanations.a: Continuous signals require the Continuous Fourier Transform, not DFT.
explanations.b: DFT works on digital samples, not analog signals.
explanations.c: DFT takes a sequence of sampled data and converts it into frequency components.
explanations.d: DFT is not restricted to noise data.

questions.question: What is the computational complexity of the DFT?

explanations.a: DFT complexity is higher than linear.
explanations.b: This is the complexity of FFT, not DFT.
explanations.c: DFT requires N multiplications for each of N outputs, making it O(N^2).
explanations.d: DFT is not logarithmic in complexity.

questions.question: Which algorithm is widely used to compute the DFT efficiently?

explanations.a: Laplace Transform is unrelated to DFT acceleration.
explanations.b: FFT reduces DFT computation time drastically.
explanations.d: Kalman Filtering is used for state estimation, not DFT computation.

questions.question: Which property of DFT states that both input and output sequences repeat every N samples?

explanations.b: Circular convolution is a result of periodic extension, not periodicity property itself.
explanations.c: DFT assumes periodicity of N for time and frequency sequences.
explanations.d: Symmetry applies mostly to real-valued input signals.

questions.question: The FFT algorithm reduces computation using which strategy?

explanations.a: FFT splits the signal into smaller parts recursively to speed computation.
explanations.c: FFT does not rely on random sampling.
explanations.d: FFT is not based on machine learning.

questions.question: The complex exponential used in DFT, e^{-j(2π/N)kn}, is known as a:

explanations.a: Kernel is a general term but not the standard DSP name here.
explanations.b: In FFT/DFT terminology, these exponential terms are called twiddle factors.
explanations.c: Impulse response refers to system behavior, not DFT basis.
explanations.d: Wavelets are used in a different transform family.

questions.question: The Cooley–Tukey algorithm is associated with:

explanations.c: It is the most commonly used FFT algorithm.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key advantage of FFT over DFT?

answers.a: FFT produces more accurate results than DFT
answers.d: FFT only works for real-valued signals

explanations.a: Both produce the same output mathematically.
explanations.b: FFT reduces operations drastically using N log N complexity.
explanations.c: Leakage depends on windowing, not FFT algorithm.
explanations.d: FFT works on both real and complex signals.

questions.question: In practical DSP applications, the DFT is mainly used for:

answers.b: Converting digital signals to analog signals

explanations.a: DFT reveals the spectral content of sampled signals.
explanations.c: DFT has no connection to random number generation.
explanations.d: DFT is not primarily a smoothing operator.
